alert.note: Alert for Bertie; Gates; Hertford; Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 3:32PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Several clusters of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Bertie, southeastern Northampton, southwestern Hertford and west central Gates Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 331 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking clusters of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Rich Square to 9 miles north of Tarboro. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 30 to 40 mph. Rainfall up to 1 inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locally heavy rainfall may result in minor flooding of poor drainage and low lying areas. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Rich Square around 345 PM EDT. Woodland around 350 PM EDT. Murfreesboro around 410 PM EDT. Ahoskie, Winton, Lewiston Woodville and Cofield around 430 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Eagletown, Milwaukee, Tunis, Kelford, Earleys, Menola, Chowan Beach, Mapleton, Republican and Jackson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
